titleInfo.title: Breakfast at Governor’s Mansion honoring Commander William Anderson, Nashville, Tennessee, 1958 September

mods.identifier: RG 412 434 Breakfast at Gov Mansion for Commd Anderson Sept1958 011

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured in foreground: Governor Frank Clement and Commander William R. Anderson (in military uniform). This photo relates to an honorary breakfast hosted at the Governor’s Mansion. Anderson commanded the Navy’s first atomic submarine, the “USS Nautilus” on its historic cruise beneath the North Pole in August, 1958. In addition to a distinguished military career, Anderson was a member of the U. S. House of Representatives from Tennessee’s 6th district (in office January 3, 1965-January 3, 1973). Frank G. Clement served as Governor of Tennessee from 1953 to 1958, and from 1963 to 1967. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
